result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob P. HETUE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess THC with intent to deliver (>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Acquire a diploma or HSED.
The Court orders expungement under Section 973.015 upon successful completion of the sentence.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

timeConds.notes:
Under the Huber Law.

Additional four (4) months county jail, under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.
To be completed within the first two (2) years of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Plea date at 09-02-2015 08:30 am
Plea hearing set for 07-14-15 at 3:30 p.m.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference reset for 06-25-15 at 2:00 p.m.
Plea hearing is set for 07-14-15 at 3:30 p.m.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 05-05-15 at 2:15 p.m.  Plea hearing is set for 07-14-15 at 3:30 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.
Anthony Lambrecht, Public Defender.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 03-19-15 at 2:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
RE:  Possess THC with intent to deliver, on 03-02-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess THC with intent to deliver.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-09-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, maintain absolute sobriety and is not to leave his residence unless to attend work or school.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.
Minutes.
